alert.note: Alert for Lower Clark Fork Region (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Missoula (Western Montana and Central Idaho)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 10 at 1:13PM MST until January 12 at 5:00AM MST by NWS Missoula
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 5 AM THURSDAY TO 5 AM MST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations between 7 and 15 inches. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. Wind chills Friday morning will drop to 30-40 degrees below zero. The combination of snow, wind, and wind chills make this a dangerous situation for people and animals. * WHERE...Evaro Hill, Highway 200 Thompson Falls to Plains, Highway 200 Trout Creek to Heron, and I-90 Lookout Pass to Haugan. * WHEN...From 5 AM Thursday to 5 AM MST Friday. * IMPACTS...Travel will be very difficult to impossible. The hazardous conditions will impact the Thursday morning and evening commutes.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
